availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry H. Wellman (Covington, Kentucky, railroad conductor.)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, railroad conductor. Native of Hanover, Germany. Son of Mary G. Wellman. Married to Sarah Wellman. Father of Aldora Wellman and Elizabeth Wellman. Conductor of passenger trains for the Covington and Lexington Railroad in 1856. Salesman in Covington in 1860. Conductor of the Kentucky Central Railroad in July 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton, Covington Ward 3, p. 631.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Clermont, Pierce, p. 252B.
Benjamin Homans, The United States Railroad Directory for 1856 (New York: B. Homans, 1856), p. 101.
Find A Grave, "Henry H. Wellman (1827-1897)," Memorial #85694980, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85694980 (accessed January 3, 2020).
KYR-0002-222-0128.
